Updated November     pm



The Orange Coast College baseball team won two out of three conference games against Mt PERIOD San Antonio last week PERIOD

The Pirates won nine conference games in a row before getting blown out in the opener versus the Mounties on Monday PERIOD In an unfamiliar scene the Pirates allowed  runs on  hits while committing two errors resulting in a final score of  PERIOD Second baseman Tyler Weaver and catcher Brandon Guy had a home run each despite the loss PERIOD

On Thursday the Pirates quickly bounced back winning the second game of the series  PERIOD A stellar complete game by Sophomore Chazz Martinez was supported by some late offense as all of OCCs runs came in the fifth inning or later PERIOD Freshman Garrett Bevacquas pinchhit tworun single in the sixth inning ended up being the difference in the comeback win PERIOD

Fridays doubleheader ended in a split with the Mounties  win in the seveninning nonconference matchup and the Pirates running away with the concluding conference game of the series  PERIOD

All games this year are considered exhibitions but the first game of the Friday doubleheaders are always nonconference PERIOD

OCC center fielder Tatsuhori Negishi scored two runs on three hits and designated hitter Chazz Martinez muscled two home runs for four RBIs total PERIOD

Martinez is  with  strikeouts in  innings over four pitching appearances this year and is hitting a stout . in conference play PERIOD

The Pirates improved to  in conference play last weekend and currently have sole possession of first place in the Orange Empire Conference PERIOD

OCC will look to continue its dominance at Saddleback College today and will return to Wendell Pickens Field in Costa Mesa on Friday for another double header PERIOD The first game of the double header is at noon and the concluding game of the series starts at  p.m on Friday PERIOD
